text: Verisk is a solutions provider
for mostly the insurance industry.

We're really happy to
be partners with AWS.

It's been a great journey as
we've completed our journey out
of our on-prem data centers

and into AWS it's really
allowed us to continue

to move quickly and to
accelerate our innovations
and get those delivered to customers.

So Discovery Navigator is a
product that, for example,
takes medical demand packages,

and these are very large
documents, hundreds of pages,

sometimes thousands of pages
that a reviewer has to go

through and understand the
extent of injury treatment plans,
summarize it
and splits those out using other AWS
services like Textract.
Prior to AI

and Gen AI, it was a very
manual, intensive process.

And so with Discovery
Navigator, we've been able

to reduce the time it takes
to review one of these files
by over 90%.

So with the
Application Modernization Lab (AML)

and moving things from
.NET Framework to .NET,

that allows us to
run on Linux servers.

And so those are more
cost effective for us.

They work better in our
Kubernetes environment,

and so we're able to
modernize our infrastructure a
little bit further with that.
And as we've been able to assign people
and take them off of other products
that they may have been on for a while
and let them specifically experiment

with Gen AI in particular,
we're still able to allow them
to leverage some of the latest
and greatest technologies out there
and apply it to their jobs.
